summary: Build a WCA-compliant speedcubing timer that uses the official WCA scramble generator, supports all WCA events with scramble text and scramble images, and works on mobile/desktop with touch-and-hold and spacebar controls.
architectural_notes: Scramble generation must use the official WCA scramble generator (not a custom/random implementation).

existing_features.title: Create a responsive speedcubing timer screen that works on both desktop and mobile layouts, with a clear scramble display area, a timer display, and basic on-screen instructions for controls.
Add an event selector that includes all official WCA events and drives scramble generation/visualization for the selected event.
Integrate the official WCA scramble generator to generate scrambles per selected WCA event, and provide a "New Scramble" action to generate the next scramble.
Display a scramble image/visualization corresponding to the currently displayed scramble and selected event, alongside the scramble text.

Implement WCA-style timer controls: on desktop, space bar touch/hold behavior (hold to arm, release to start; press to stop); on mobile, touch-and-hold to arm then release to start; tap/press to stop.
After stopping the timer, keep the final time visible until the next start, and ensure generating a new scramble is available without breaking timer state (e.g., only when not running).

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) appropriate for a speedcubing timer, and enforce it consistently across the app (avoid default/basic styling).

new_feature_requests.summary: Use the official WCA scramble generator to generate scrambles per event
Support all WCA events and show the correct scramble for the selected event
Display scramble images/visualizations for each generated scramble
Implement a timer UI that works on both mobile and desktop
Add touch-and-hold to start/stop on mobile and spacebar control on desktop

projectName: WCA speedcubing timer with official WCA scrambles (all events), scramble images, and mobile/desktop controls
